analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs 'dis gzhan rnams kyang ngo //
translated: In the same way, by this method, the others.

analyzed: de la re zhig bi pra'i sgra ni byings dang rnam dbye bor ba'i don dang ldan pa rtags so zhes pas rtags kyi ming can no //

original: de las pha rol tu rnam par dbye ba rnams te /
analyzed: de las pha rol tu rnam par dbye ba rnams te /
translated: Beyond that, the case endings are

original: si aoo dzas zhes pa la sogs pas si la sogs pa thams cad kyi skabs thob pa la /
analyzed: si aoo dzas zhes pa la sogs pas si la sogs pa thams cad kyi skabs thob pa la /

original: dang po'i don brjod par 'dod pa na rtags kyi don gyi tshig la rnam dbye dang po'o zhes pas rnam dbye dang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po'i don brjod par 'dod pa na rtags kyi don gyi tshig la rnam dbye dang po'o zhes pas rnam dbye dang por 'gyur ro //
translated: When one wishes to express the meaning of the first, the word for the meaning of the sign becomes the first case.

original: de la don gcig brjod par 'dod pa na gcig gi tshig si'o //
analyzed: de la don gcig brjod par 'dod pa na gcig gi tshig si'o //
translated: When one wishes to express a single meaning, the word for one is si.

original: si'i ai yig ni brjod pa'i don te khyad par gyi don ma yin no //
analyzed: si'i ai yig ni brjod pa'i don te khyad par gyi don ma yin no //
translated: The vowel i of si is the expressed meaning, not the meaning of a distinction.

original: a'i yig mtha' las si'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams la /
analyzed: a'i yig mtha' las si'o zhes pa la sogs pa rnams la /
translated: In the words such as si, which end in the vowel a,

original: don dang ldan pa 'dzin pa na su p'i sa yig 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa 'dzin pa na su p'i sa yig 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: when one grasps what is meaningful, one does not grasp the vowel u.🔽When one grasps what is not related, one does not grasp what is related.

original: rjes su 'brel @2b pa med pa 'dzin pa na rjes su 'brel pa dang bcas pa'i ma yin no zhes gzhan dag go mtha' na yod pa'i sa yig rnams re pha dang sa dag gi rnam par gcad bya'o zhes pas rnam par gcad bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel @2b pa med pa 'dzin pa na rjes su 'brel pa dang bcas pa'i ma yin no zhes gzhan dag go mtha' na yod pa'i sa yig rnams re pha dang sa dag gi rnam par gcad bya'o zhes pas rnam par gcad bya'o //
translated: The vowel sa at the end of the others should be deleted by the visarga and the sa.

original: bi pra:/ don gnyis brjod par 'dod pa na gnyis kyi tshig aoo'o //
analyzed: bi pra:/ don gnyis brjod par 'dod pa na gnyis kyi tshig aoo'o //
translated: When one wishes to express two meanings, the word for two is ao.

original: rim pa las ma 'das par phral bar bya'o zhes pas yi ge bsdoms pa rnams rim pa las ma 'das par phral bar bya zhing so sor bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa las ma 'das par phral bar bya'o zhes pas yi ge bsdoms pa rnams rim pa las ma 'das par phral bar bya zhing so sor bya'o //
translated: The syllables that are combined should be separated without going beyond the order, thus the combined syllables should be separated without going beyond the order and made individual.

original: ao yig la aoo ste aoo yig la'ang ngo zhes pas aa'i yi ge aoo yig dang / aoo yig pha rol la aoo ru 'gyur zhing pha rol yang dbyi ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: ao yig la aoo ste aoo yig la'ang ngo zhes pas aa'i yi ge aoo yig dang / aoo yig pha rol la aoo ru 'gyur zhing pha rol yang dbyi ba 'thob bo //
translated: The syllable o has o and also o is said, thus the syllable a becomes o and the syllable o becomes o on the other side, and the other side also obtains the deletion.

original: gsal byed dbyangs med pa pha rol gyi yi ger drang ngo zhes pas gsal byed gang dbyangs med pa de pha rol gyi yi ger drang par bya'o //
analyzed: gsal byed dbyangs med pa pha rol gyi yi ger drang ngo zhes pas gsal byed gang dbyangs med pa de pha rol gyi yi ger drang par bya'o //
translated: The consonant without a vowel is drawn to the other side of the syllable, thus the consonant that does not have a vowel should be drawn to the other side of the syllable.🔽viprati

original: bi proo / mang po'i don brjod par 'dod pa na mang bo'i tshig dzas so //
analyzed: bi proo / mang po'i don brjod par 'dod pa na mang bo'i tshig dzas so //
translated: When one wishes to express the meaning of many, it is done with the word ja of many.

original: dza yig ni dzas thams cad a'i'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: dza yig ni dzas thams cad a'i'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
translated: The syllable ja is the meaning of the distinction ja is all ai.

original: aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes spyir btang nas /
analyzed: aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes spyir btang nas /
translated: The syllable a has a long sound, having stated the general rule,

original: dzas la'o zhes pas rtags mtha'i aa yig dzas pha rol la ring por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dzas la'o zhes pas rtags mtha'i aa yig dzas pha rol la ring por 'gyur ro //
translated: ja is la, thus the final a of the sign becomes long on the other side with ja.

original: mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la ring por 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la ring por 'gyur te /
translated: The long vowel is similar to the short vowel.

original: pha rol yang dbyi'o //🔽pi pr'a: gnyis pa la sogs pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa dang / yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa dang / 'byung khungs dang / bdag po la sogs pa dang / gzhi rnams la'o zhes pas lhag ma gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba drug rnams /
analyzed: pha rol yang dbyi'o // pi pr'a: gnyis pa la sogs pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa dang / yang dag par rab tu sbyin pa dang / 'byung khungs dang / bdag po la sogs pa dang / gzhi rnams la'o zhes pas lhag ma gnyis pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba drug rnams /
translated: The long vowel is like the short vowel.🔽When the meaning of the second case ending and so on is to be expressed, the remaining ones are for the meaning of instrument, for the meaning of benefactor, for the meaning of source, for the meaning of owner and so on and for the meaning of basis.

original: las la sogs pa'i don drug rnams la rim pa ji lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: las la sogs pa'i don drug rnams la rim pa ji lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: The remaining six divisions of the second case ending and so on are for the six meanings of instrument and so on.

original: gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams la gcig gi tshig aa ma la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams la gcig gi tshig aa ma la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The words for the single meaning and so on are the words for the single meaning a and so on.

original: aa yig la dbyi'o zhes pa rtags kyi aa yig aa yig thun mong ba las dbyi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa yig la dbyi'o zhes pa rtags kyi aa yig aa yig thun mong ba las dbyi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The long vowel is like the short vowel. The long vowel is like the short vowel.🔽vipraṃ

original: bi pram / bi proo /
analyzed: bi pram / bi proo /

original: shas kyi sha yig ni shas kyi aa yig ste sa'i 'ang bud med ma yin pa la na'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to /
analyzed: shas kyi sha yig ni shas kyi aa yig ste sa'i 'ang bud med ma yin pa la na'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to /
translated: The śa of śa is the a of śa. The meaning of the special is that the a of śa is not a feminine.

original: shas la ste sa'i 'ang na'o zhes pas rtags mtha'i aa yeg shas pha rol la ring por 'gyur zhing sa'ang na ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shas la ste sa'i 'ang na'o zhes pas rtags mtha'i aa yeg shas pha rol la ring por 'gyur zhing sa'ang na ru 'gyur ro //
translated: The word or indicates that the final a is elided in the case of the word śaḥ, and it becomes long in the case of the word paraḥ, and it becomes ru in the case of the word svaḥ.

original: ra sha ri yig rnams la zhes pa la sogs pas na nyid thob mod /
analyzed: ra sha ri yig rnams la zhes pa la sogs pas na nyid thob mod /
translated: The word na and so on indicates that the final a is obtained.🔽 The word not negates it.

original: mtha' ma yin pa zhes pas bkag go //🔽bi pr'an / gsum pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams /
analyzed: mtha' ma yin pa zhes pas bkag go // bi pr'an / gsum pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams /
translated: The word viparyayāt means from the opposite.

original: las dang / byed pa zhes pa la @3a * //
analyzed: las dang / byed pa zhes pa la @3a * //
translated: When one wishes to express the meaning of the third case, the remaining [cases] are expressed by the words karma, kartṛ, and so on.

original: sogs pas gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams la gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pas gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams la gsum pa'o //
translated: The word eka and so on indicates the meanings of the singular and so on.

original: t'a zhes pa 'di'i t'i yig t'a aoos dag la ae'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: t'a zhes pa 'di'i t'i yig t'a aoos dag la ae'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
translated: The word tā means the letter ta. The word tā āiḥ has the meaning of a special case.

original: ai nar t'a'o zhes pas aa yig mtha' rtags las pha rol gyi t'a ai na ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ai nar t'a'o zhes pas aa yig mtha' rtags las pha rol gyi t'a ai na ru 'gyur ro //
translated: The word anar means the letter a. The word tā anar means that the final a becomes an a in the case of the word following it.

original: aa'i yi ge ai'i yi ge la ae'o zhes pas aa'i yi ge ai'i yi ge pha rol la ae nyid du 'gyur zhing pha rol yang dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa'i yi ge ai'i yi ge la ae'o zhes pas aa'i yi ge ai'i yi ge pha rol la ae nyid du 'gyur zhing pha rol yang dbyi'o //
translated: The word aiḥ means the letter ai. The word aiḥ aiḥ means that the letter ai becomes ai in the case of the letter following it, and the following is also a vowel.

original: ra dang sha dang ri'i yi ge rnams las mtha' ma yin pa'i na'i na ste /
analyzed: ra dang sha dang ri'i yi ge rnams las mtha' ma yin pa'i na'i na ste /
translated: The na of na, which is not the last of the letters ra, śa, and ri,🔽and the ka of the ka group and the pa group, which are in the middle, are also.

original: dbyangs dang ha dang ya dang wa dang ka sde dang pa sde bar na yod kyang ngo zhes pa'i kyang gi sgra las bar na med pa yang ngo //
analyzed: dbyangs dang ha dang ya dang wa dang ka sde dang pa sde bar na yod kyang ngo zhes pa'i kyang gi sgra las bar na med pa yang ngo //
translated: The word also in the statement “also in the middle” indicates that they are also not in the middle.

original: bi pre na aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes pas aa yig rtags mtha' ni rnam dbye sgra ldan la ring por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bi pre na aa yig sgra ldan la ring po'o zhes pas aa yig rtags mtha' ni rnam dbye sgra ldan la ring por 'gyur ro //
translated: The statement “The long of viprēṇa, which has the sound of the letter a” indicates that the final sign of the letter a becomes long when it has the sound of a case ending.

original: bi pr'a bhyam /
analyzed: bi pr'a bhyam /

original: bhis aees yang na'o zhes pas bhis kyi aees su bsgyur ro //
analyzed: bhis aees yang na'o zhes pas bhis kyi aees su bsgyur ro //
translated: The statement “The ai of bhis, or also” indicates that the ai of bhis is changed to ai.

original: ae yig la aee ste ae yig la'ang ngo zhes pas aa'i yi ge ae yig dang aee yig pha rol la aee yig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: ae yig la aee ste ae yig la'ang ngo zhes pas aa'i yi ge ae yig dang aee yig pha rol la aee yig tu 'gyur te /
translated: The statement “The ai of the letter e, or also of the letter e” indicates that the ai letter becomes ai in the case of the letter e and ai.

original: phyi ma'ang dbyi'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'ang dbyi'o //
translated: The latter is also a case ending.🔽viprēḥ

original: bi pre:/ bzhi pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams la bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: bi pre:/ bzhi pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams la bzhi pa'o //
translated: When one wishes to express the meaning of the fourth, the remaining ones are stated by the words “the one” and so on. The meaning of the fourth is in the case of one and so on.

original: de'i tshig nga yig ni nge yig la'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: de'i tshig nga yig ni nge yig la'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
translated: The word for it is ya, with the special meaning of the letter ya.

original: de ya'o zhes pas aa yig rtags mtha' las pha rol gyi de'i tshig ya ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ya'o zhes pas aa yig rtags mtha' las pha rol gyi de'i tshig ya ru 'gyur ro //
translated: With the word that, the letter a becomes the final sign of the word for it, ya.

original: aa yig ring por sgra ldan la'o zhes pas aa yig gi ring por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa yig ring por sgra ldan la'o zhes pas aa yig gi ring por 'gyur ro //
translated: With long a, the letter a becomes long.

original: nges par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rigs pa 'dir 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nges par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rigs pa 'dir 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: This reasoning of the characteristics of definite engagement does not apply here.

original: yi ge 'dzin pa na rgyu mtshan nyid las shes pa'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: yi ge 'dzin pa na rgyu mtshan nyid las shes pa'i rigs pa las so //
translated: When holding the letters, it is from the reasoning of knowledge based on the characteristics.

original: bi pr'a ya /
analyzed: bi pr'a ya /

original: bi pr'a bhy'am /
analyzed: bi pr'a bhy'am /

original: dhuta mang po nyid la ni ao'o zhes pas aa yig rtags mtha' dhuta mang po nyid pha rol la ae yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dhuta mang po nyid la ni ao'o zhes pas aa yig rtags mtha' dhuta mang po nyid pha rol la ae yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: With many, it is o, so the letter a becomes the final sign of dhūta many, becoming the letter e on the other side.🔽viprābhyāṃ

original: bi pra bhya:/ lnga pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams la lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bi pra bhya:/ lnga pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams la lnga pa'o //
translated: When wanting to express the meaning of the fifth, the remaining ones are action, agent, etc. The five are for the meanings of one and so on.

original: nga si nga yig dang ai yig dag ni nga si smad 'o zhes khyad par gyi don dag go //
analyzed: nga si nga yig dang ai yig dag ni nga si smad 'o zhes khyad par gyi don dag go //
translated: The words aṃśa and aṃśa are distinguished by the meaning of aṃśa.

original: nga si a'a ta'o zhes pas rtags mtha' aa yig las nga si a'ata tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nga si a'a ta'o zhes pas rtags mtha' aa yig las nga si a'ata tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The word aṃśa is āta, so aṃśa becomes āta from the final aṃśa.

original: mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la ring bor 'gyur te /
analyzed: mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la ring bor 'gyur te /

original: phyi ma'ang dbyi'o //🔽bi pr'a ta /
analyzed: phyi ma'ang dbyi'o // bi pr'a ta /
translated: The latter is also the same.🔽Vipra.🔽Vipra.

original: bi phra bhy'am /
analyzed: bi phra bhy'am /
translated: Viprebhyaḥ.🔽When the meaning of the sixth case is desired, the remaining ones are from the meaning of one and so on.

original: bi pre bhya:/ drug pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las @3b dang byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams la drug pa'o //
analyzed: bi pre bhya:/ drug pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las @3b dang byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams la drug pa'o //
translated: The aṃśa of aṃśa is the ā of aṃśa.

original: ngas kyi nga yig ni nga si ngas dag gi aa dbyi ba 'ang ngo zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: ngas kyi nga yig ni nga si ngas dag gi aa dbyi ba 'ang ngo zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
translated: The word aṃśa is āta, so aṃśa becomes āta from the final aṃśa.🔽Viprasya.

original: ngas ni sya'o zhes pas aa yig rtags mtha' las pha rol gyi ngas sya ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngas ni sya'o zhes pas aa yig rtags mtha' las pha rol gyi ngas sya ru 'gyur ro //
translated: The word āṃśa is āṃśa, so āṃśa becomes āṃśa from the final āṃśa.

original: bi pra sya /
analyzed: bi pra sya /

original: aos la yang ngo zhes pas aa yig rtags mtha' aos pha rol la ae yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aos la yang ngo zhes pas aa yig rtags mtha' aos pha rol la ae yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The word āṃśa is āṃśa, so āṃśa becomes āṃśa from the final āṃśa.🔽Viprebhyaḥ.

original: ae aa ya'o zhes pas aa ya ru bsgyur te /
analyzed: ae aa ya'o zhes pas aa ya ru bsgyur te /
translated: By āyāvaḥ, āya is changed to āyu.

original: bi pra yo: //
analyzed: bi pra yo: //

original: thung ngu dang na 'di dang shraddh'a rnams las si dbyi'o zhes spyir btang nas /
analyzed: thung ngu dang na 'di dang shraddh'a rnams las si dbyi'o zhes spyir btang nas /
translated: Having made a general statement from the short and na and this and śraddhā,

original: a'i la'ang nu'o zhes pas thung ngu dang n'a d'i dang shraddh'a rnams las a'a ma pha rol la nu a'a ga ma ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: a'i la'ang nu'o zhes pas thung ngu dang n'a d'i dang shraddh'a rnams las a'a ma pha rol la nu a'a ga ma ru 'gyur ro //
translated: by ālāṃ nuḥ, from the short and nā and ā and śraddhā, ā becomes nuḥ on the other side, and āgama becomes agama.

original: gsum pa sogs la ni pha rol gyi dang po'o zhes auta rjes su 'brel pa'i a'a ga ma gsum la sogs pa'i rnam dbye la pha rol gyi ste /
analyzed: gsum pa sogs la ni pha rol gyi dang po'o zhes auta rjes su 'brel pa'i a'a ga ma gsum la sogs pa'i rnam dbye la pha rol gyi ste /
translated: In the third case, etc., it is the first of the other.

original: rnam dbye'i tshig gis dang por 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam dbye'i tshig gis dang por 'gyur te /
translated: The first becomes by the word of the case

original: de 'dzin pas gzung bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de 'dzin pas gzung bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: . The meaning is: it should be taken by grasping it.

original: snga ma bzhin du ring po nyid dang na nyid dag go //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ring po nyid dang na nyid dag go //
translated: As before, the long and the na are the same.

original: bi pr'a n'a ma /
analyzed: bi pr'a n'a ma /

original: bdun pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams la bdun pa'o //
analyzed: bdun pa'i don brjod par 'dod pa na lhag ma rnams las dang byed pa zhes pa la sogs pas gcig nyid la sogs pa'i don rnams la bdun pa'o //
translated: When the meaning of the seventh is to be expressed, by the rest and by the agent, etc., the seventh is for the meanings of one, etc.

original: di'i nga yig ni di ni smin no zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: di'i nga yig ni di ni smin no zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
translated: The letter ṅa is the object of distinction in the expression “this is ripe.”

original: aa'i yi ge ai'i yi ge la ae ste pha rol yang dbyi'o //
analyzed: aa'i yi ge ai'i yi ge la ae ste pha rol yang dbyi'o //
translated: The letter ā is the letter i, and the other is the vowel.🔽vipre

original: bi pre / bi pre yo:/
analyzed: bi pre / bi pre yo:/

original: su pa'i pa yig ni the tshom sel ba la 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: su pa'i pa yig ni the tshom sel ba la 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The letter pa is the grasping of doubt.

original: de'i tshe ni si la aoo ste si dbyi ba 'ang ngo zhes pa la sogs pa la su pa la'o zhes bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa yongs su spang ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni si la aoo ste si dbyi ba 'ang ngo zhes pa la sogs pa la su pa la'o zhes bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa yongs su spang ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, the letter si is ā, and the letter vi is also. Thus, it should be established that the letter su is the meaning of “abandonment.”

original: gang rjes su 'brel pa mi sbyor ro zhes pas ai yig la sogs pa rjes su 'brel pa rnams thams cad dbyi'o //
analyzed: gang rjes su 'brel pa mi sbyor ro zhes pas ai yig la sogs pa rjes su 'brel pa rnams thams cad dbyi'o //
translated: Since it is not connected, all the connected letters such as the letter i are abandoned.

original: dhu ta mang po nyid la ni ae'o //
analyzed: dhu ta mang po nyid la ni ae'o //
translated: The letter ai is the many dhutas.

original: n'a mi dang ka dang ra las pha rol rkyen dang rnam 'gyur dang / a'a ga ma la gnas pa'i si sha ste /
analyzed: n'a mi dang ka dang ra las pha rol rkyen dang rnam 'gyur dang / a'a ga ma la gnas pa'i si sha ste /
translated: The letter na is the other side of the condition and the modification of the letter ka and ra, and the letter śa that is located in the future.

original: nu dang rnam par gcad bya dang / sha bar na yod kyang ngo zhes pas n'a ma'i yi ge rnams las pha rol rkyen dang rnam 'gyur dang aa ga ma la gnas pa'i mtha' ma yin pa'i si sha ru 'gyur zhing /🔽nu dang rnam par gcad bya dang / sha bar na yod kyang ste /
analyzed: nu dang rnam par gcad bya dang / sha bar na yod kyang ngo zhes pas n'a ma'i yi ge rnams las pha rol rkyen dang rnam 'gyur dang aa ga ma la gnas pa'i mtha' ma yin pa'i si sha ru 'gyur zhing / nu dang rnam par gcad bya dang / sha bar na yod kyang ste /
translated: The letter s is the final of the nāma letters, which are beyond the conditions, the modifications, and the next āga, and it is also in the place of śa.

original: kyang gi sgra las bar na med kyang ngo //
analyzed: kyang gi sgra las bar na med kyang ngo //
translated: The word “also” means that it is also in the place of śa, even though it is not in between.

original: bi pre shu /
analyzed: bi pre shu /

original: bod pa brjod par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: bod pa brjod par 'dod pa na /
translated: If one wishes to say “in Tibet,”

original: bi pra'i sgra'i sngon du he'i sgra sbyar te /🔽de gsal bar byed pa'i don can gyis na don dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir rtags kyi ming @4a * //
analyzed: bi pra'i sgra'i sngon du he'i sgra sbyar te / de gsal bar byed pa'i don can gyis na don dang ldan pa nyid kyi phyir rtags kyi ming @4a * //
translated: the word he is added before the word viprāḥ.🔽Since that has the meaning of making that clear, it has the meaning of “having a reason.”

original: can yin pas na /
analyzed: can yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, it is a name that has the meaning of a reason.

original: rtags kyi don tsam la dang po'i gcig gi tshig si ste /
analyzed: rtags kyi don tsam la dang po'i gcig gi tshig si ste /
translated: Therefore, the word “first” is added to the mere meaning of the reason.

original: de'ang mi zad pa las kyang ngo zhes pas 'jig go //
analyzed: de'ang mi zad pa las kyang ngo zhes pas 'jig go //
translated: Moreover, the word “also” is added to the word “imperishable.”

original: he bi pra zhes gnas pa la bod pa la'ang ngo zhes pa dang po'o //
analyzed: he bi pra zhes gnas pa la bod pa la'ang ngo zhes pa dang po'o //
translated: The word “also” is added to the word “first.”

original: kun du bod pa la si sambuddhi'o zhes pas si'i ming ni sambuddhi'o //
analyzed: kun du bod pa la si sambuddhi'o zhes pas si'i ming ni sambuddhi'o //

translated: vittapa.🔽The sound hā hā, which ends with the letter a, expresses gods and gandharvas.

original: dzi ha ta'i byings las bya ba rtogs byed ni byings so zhes byings kyi ming yin pa na nye ba'i tshig h'a'i sgra la h'a zhes byas nas /
analyzed: dzi ha ta'i byings las bya ba rtogs byed ni byings so zhes byings kyi ming yin pa na nye ba'i tshig h'a'i sgra la h'a zhes byas nas /
translated: The word hā is a nominal affix for the verbal root jīh, which means to understand.

original: dza h'a ti zhes pa dag yin pa na aang las man dang ko ni pa dang wa ni pa dang wa tsi rnams so zhes pas wa tsi'o //
analyzed: dza h'a ti zhes pa dag yin pa na aang las man dang ko ni pa dang wa ni pa dang wa tsi rnams so zhes pas wa tsi'o //
translated: The name of the first is Jahatī, and the second is Vatsī.

original: ai yig ni sbyar ba med pa'i wa'i dbyi'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
analyzed: ai yig ni sbyar ba med pa'i wa'i dbyi'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //
translated: The letter i is the vowel of the letter va without the addition of a vowel.🔽This is the meaning of the special rule.

original: 'di nyid kyis wa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis wa yig dbyi'o //
translated: By this very [rule] the letter va is the vowel.

original: tsa yig ni brjod pa'i don to ;
analyzed: tsa yig ni brjod pa'i don to ;
translated: The letter ca is the meaning of the expression.

original: / de nas rtags kyi ming can te si la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: / de nas rtags kyi ming can te si la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Then come the letters with the names of the signs, such as si and so on.

original: rjes su 'brel pa dbyi ba dang / rnam par gcad bya dag kyang snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'brel pa dbyi ba dang / rnam par gcad bya dag kyang snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The following are elided and the distinctions are as before.🔽hā hāḥ🔽In the two letters o and au, the o and so on are as before.

original: h'a h'a:/ aoo yig gnyis la snga ma bzhin du aoo nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: h'a h'a:/ aoo yig gnyis la snga ma bzhin du aoo nyid la sogs pa'o //

original: h'a hoo // dzas shas dag gi ma byas pa'i ring po las pha rol aa yig gi @4b dbyi'o //
analyzed: h'a hoo // dzas shas dag gi ma byas pa'i ring po las pha rol aa yig gi @4b dbyi'o //
translated: In the long [vowels] not made by ja, the vowel of the letter a is beyond.🔽hā hāḥ

original: h'a h'a:/ h'a h'am:/
analyzed: h'a h'a:/ h'a h'am:/

original: h'a hoo / wa ma brtsegs pa ma yin pa las aana'i aa dbyi ba dang / cho ga snga ma lam phyis pa bzhin 'ang ngo zhes pa 'di las dbyi ba rjes su 'jug pa na byings kyi a'a ghuta ma yin pa'i dbyangs la'o zhes pas ghu ta ma yin pa'i dbyangs pha rol la aa yig dbyi'o //
analyzed: h'a hoo / wa ma brtsegs pa ma yin pa las aana'i aa dbyi ba dang / cho ga snga ma lam phyis pa bzhin 'ang ngo zhes pa 'di las dbyi ba rjes su 'jug pa na byings kyi a'a ghuta ma yin pa'i dbyangs la'o zhes pas ghu ta ma yin pa'i dbyangs pha rol la aa yig dbyi'o //
translated: In the case of a non-compounded fox, the a of an is elided, and the a of the previous ritual is elided like the path. When the elided a is applied, it is to the vowel of the root that is not a guta vowel. Therefore, the vowel of the other side that is not a guta vowel is elided by the a vowel.🔽HAH HA.

analyzed: he h'a h'a: de bzhin du a'a yig gi mtha' can rnams kyang rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, those ending in the letter a should be understood by implication.

original: gal te yang tshig le'ur byas pa las aa yig gi mtha' can dngos su ma brjod pa de lta na'ang gzhan rnams kyang phyogs 'dis shes pa'i tshig las don gyis brjod pa kho na'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gal te yang tshig le'ur byas pa las aa yig gi mtha' can dngos su ma brjod pa de lta na'ang gzhan rnams kyang phyogs 'dis shes pa'i tshig las don gyis brjod pa kho na'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Even though the metrical version does not actually state the syllable ending in a, still, since the others are also stated by implication in this way, it is taught that they are stated by the meaning of the words.

original: ai yig gi mtha' can rnams brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ai yig gi mtha' can rnams brjod par bya'o //
translated: Those ending in the syllable i are to be stated.

original: aagni'i sgra las si la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: aagni'i sgra las si la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: From the word agni, the syllables si and so on.

original: dang po gcig gi tshig gi re pha dang sa dag gi rnam par gcad bya'o //
analyzed: dang po gcig gi tshig gi re pha dang sa dag gi rnam par gcad bya'o //
translated: The first one is to be elided in the word re and in sa.🔽agniḥ

original: aagni:/ aoo yig ni snga ma'o zhes pas aagni las pha rol gyi aoo yig snga ma'i dbyangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aagni:/ aoo yig ni snga ma'o zhes pas aagni las pha rol gyi aoo yig snga ma'i dbyangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the syllable o is the previous one, the syllable o of the following agni becomes the previous vowel.

original: mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la zhes pa la sogs pas ring po dang pha rol dbyi ba dag go //
analyzed: mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la zhes pa la sogs pas ring po dang pha rol dbyi ba dag go //

translated: The a of am from agni.

original: nu dang bcas pa'i a'am la ring po'o //
analyzed: nu dang bcas pa'i a'am la ring po'o //
translated: The long ā is a with a nose and a long vowel.

original: aagn'i n'am / di snga ma dang bcas pa aoo'o zhes @5a * //
analyzed: aagn'i n'am / di snga ma dang bcas pa aoo'o zhes @5a * //
translated: The āṃ is a with the preceding vowel.

original: pas ai yig gnyis dag aoo yig go //
analyzed: pas ai yig gnyis dag aoo yig go //
translated: Thus, the two i vowels are the o vowel.

original: aagnoo / aagn+yo:/ snga ma bzhin du su'i sa sha nyid do //🔽aagni shu / kun du bod pa la sam buddhi la'ang ngo zhes ai aeta'o //
analyzed: aagnoo / aagn+yo:/ snga ma bzhin du su'i sa sha nyid do // aagni shu / kun du bod pa la sam buddhi la'ang ngo zhes ai aeta'o //
translated: The agn is agn, agn, as before.🔽The śa is the same as the śa.🔽The śu is the same as the śu.

original: thung du n'a d'i shraddh'a rnams las si dbye'o //
analyzed: thung du n'a d'i shraddh'a rnams las si dbye'o //
translated: The short i is the same as the i.

original: he aaghe / he aagn'i /
analyzed: he aaghe / he aagn'i /
translated: The he aghe, he agni,🔽he agnayaḥ, and so forth.

original: he aagna ya:/ de bzhin du ai yig gi mtha' can gzhan rnams kyang ste /
analyzed: he aagna ya:/ de bzhin du ai yig gi mtha' can gzhan rnams kyang ste /
translated: The other ones ending with the i vowel are the same.

analyzed: yang ai yig gi mtha' can nyid du khyad par med na'ang /
translated: Again, although there is no difference in having the letter i at the end,

original: 'ga' zhig la khyad par yang mthong ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la khyad par yang mthong ste /
translated: a difference is also seen in some.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: sa khi dang pa ti'i sgra dag go //

original: sa khi zhes gnas pa la si la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sa khi zhes gnas pa la si la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Sakhi, in the sense of dwelling, has si and so on.

original: au sha nas pu ru dan shas aa ne has rnams kyi si la aan mtha'o zhes pa rjes su 'jug pa las kha'i yang ngo zhes pas sa kha'i mtha' aan du bsgyur ro //
analyzed: au sha nas pu ru dan shas aa ne has rnams kyi si la aan mtha'o zhes pa rjes su 'jug pa las kha'i yang ngo zhes pas sa kha'i mtha' aan du bsgyur ro //
translated: From the uṣṇas, the si of puruṣa, and the a of aneha, the ending is an. Also the ending of kha is an means that the ending of sakha is changed to an.

original: ghuta la'ang sam buddhi ma yin pa la'o zhes pas ring po'o //
analyzed: ghuta la'ang sam buddhi ma yin pa la'o zhes pas ring po'o //
translated: Also, ghut to la, not in sambuddhi means the long [form].

original: gsal byed las kyang ngo zhes pas si dbyi'o //
analyzed: gsal byed las kyang ngo zhes pas si dbyi'o //
translated: Also from a consonant means the si vowel.

original: rtags mtha'i na yig go zhes pas na dbyi'o //
analyzed: rtags mtha'i na yig go zhes pas na dbyi'o //
translated: Also, the final sign is na means the na vowel.

original: sa kh'a / ghuta la ni ae'o zhes pas sa khi'i mtha' ghuta pha rol la aee ru 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa kh'a / ghuta la ni ae'o zhes pas sa khi'i mtha' ghuta pha rol la aee ru 'gyur ro //
translated: Sakha, ghut to la, and ai to e means that the ending of sakha becomes ghut, and the other becomes ai.

original: aee a'a ya'o //
analyzed: aee a'a ya'o //

original: phyi mar 'gro ba'o //🔽sa kh'a yoo /
analyzed: phyi mar 'gro ba'o // sa kh'a yoo /
translated: goes to the next.🔽sakha yo🔽sakha yaḥ

original: sa kh'a ya:/ sa kha yam /
analyzed: sa kh'a ya:/ sa kha yam /

original: sa kh'a yoo /
analyzed: sa kh'a yoo /

original: shas la aagni bzhin te /
analyzed: shas la aagni bzhin te /

original: sa kh'i na /
analyzed: sa kh'i na /

original: sa khi t'a sogs la aagni ma yin no zhes pas sa khi'i ai yig gi'ang dbyangs dang po can la aagni'i ming bkag pa'i phyir t'a n'a'o zhes pa la sogs pas n'a la sogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sa khi t'a sogs la aagni ma yin no zhes pas sa khi'i ai yig gi'ang dbyangs dang po can la aagni'i ming bkag pa'i phyir t'a n'a'o zhes pa la sogs pas n'a la sogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: In sakhitā, etc., it is not agni. Thus, the name agni is prohibited for those having the first vowel of the i of sakhi. Therefore, tā, nā, etc. do not become nā, etc.

original: ai'i yi ge ya ste zhes pa la sogs pas ya nyid kho na'o //🔽sa khy'a / sa khi bhy'am /
analyzed: ai'i yi ge ya ste zhes pa la sogs pas ya nyid kho na'o // sa khy'a / sa khi bhy'am /
translated: The letter i is ya. Thus, etc. It is only ya.🔽Sakhāyo, sakhibhāṃ,

original: sa khi bhi:/ sa khye /
analyzed: sa khi bhi:/ sa khye /

original: sa khi bhy'am /
analyzed: sa khi bhy'am /

original: sa khi bhya:/ nga si ngas dag gi aa au'o zhes pas sa khi'i sgra las pha rol gyi nga si ngas dag gi aa yig au ru 'gyur zhing snga ma bzhin du ya nyid do //🔽sa khyu:/ sa khi bhy'am /
analyzed: sa khi bhya:/ nga si ngas dag gi aa au'o zhes pas sa khi'i sgra las pha rol gyi nga si ngas dag gi aa yig au ru 'gyur zhing snga ma bzhin du ya nyid do // sa khyu:/ sa khi bhy'am /
translated: sakhibhyaḥ, by the rule the a and au of the ng and s become a and o, the a of the ng and s after the word sakhi become a and o respectively, and it is only ya as before.🔽Sakhyuḥ, sakhibhāṃ,

original: sa khi bhya:/ sa khyu:/
analyzed: sa khi bhya:/ sa khyu:/

original: si khyo:/ a'a ma la aagna bzhin te /🔽sa kh'i n'am /
analyzed: si khyo:/ a'a ma la aagna bzhin te /🔽sa kh'i n'am /
translated: sakhyoḥ, like agni in āmalagni.🔽In sakhā.

original: sa khi pa ti dag gi ngi'o zhes pas ngi aoo ru 'gyur gyi snga ma dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa khi pa ti dag gi ngi'o zhes pas ngi aoo ru 'gyur gyi snga ma dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The genitive of sakapada is ngio, not ngi.

original: sa khyoo / sa khyoo:/🔽su pa'i sha nyid do //
analyzed: sa khyoo / sa khyoo:/ su pa'i sha nyid do //

original: @5b sa khi shu /
analyzed: @5b sa khi shu /

original: kun du bod pa la sam buddha ma yin pa la zhes rjes su 'jug pa na sa khi'i 'ang ngo zhes pas sa buddhi la aana'i mthar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: kun du bod pa la sam buddha ma yin pa la zhes rjes su 'jug pa na sa khi'i 'ang ngo zhes pas sa buddhi la aana'i mthar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If the word sakhi is followed by the suffix -buddham, the sakhi does not change to buddhi.

original: des na sam buddhi la'ang ngo zhes pa ae nyid kho na'o //🔽he sa kha /
analyzed: des na sam buddhi la'ang ngo zhes pa ae nyid kho na'o // he sa kha /
translated: Therefore, the word sambuddhalam is also just e.🔽he sakha,

original: he sa kh'a yoo /
analyzed: he sa kh'a yoo /

original: he sa kh'a ya:/
analyzed: he sa kh'a ya:/

original: pa ti'i sgra'i ni tshig sdud la aagni dang 'dra ba'i gzugs te 'ba' zhig pa ni pa ti bsdu ba ma yin pa la'o zhes pas t'a la sogs pa'i dbyangs la pa ti'i ai yig gi aagni'i ming bkag pa'i phyir thams cad sa khi'i sgra dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: pa ti'i sgra'i ni tshig sdud la aagni dang 'dra ba'i gzugs te 'ba' zhig pa ni pa ti bsdu ba ma yin pa la'o zhes pas t'a la sogs pa'i dbyangs la pa ti'i ai yig gi aagni'i ming bkag pa'i phyir thams cad sa khi'i sgra dang 'dra'o //
translated: The word pathi is a compound word with the form of agni, but alone it is not a compound of pathi. Therefore, the vowel i of pathi is blocked by the name agni for the vowels ta and so on. Therefore, all are like the word sakhi.

original: gzhan aagni'i sgra dang 'dra ba'i gzugs su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan aagni'i sgra dang 'dra ba'i gzugs su blta bar bya ste /
translated: The other should be seen as having the form of the word agni.

original: pa ti:/ pa t'i:/
analyzed: pa ti:/ pa t'i:/

analyzed: pa ta ya:/ pa ti ma /

analyzed: pa t'i / pa ti na / pa ty'a / pa ti bhy'am /

analyzed: pa ti bhi:/ pa tye / pa ti bhy'am / pa ti bhy'a:/ pa tyu:/

analyzed: pa ti bhy'am / pa ti bhya:/ pa tyu:/ pa tyo:/ pa t'i n'am /

original: pa too / pa tyoo:/
analyzed: pa too / pa tyoo:/

original: pa ti shu /
analyzed: pa ti shu /

original: sa khi t'a sogs la aagni bzhin ma yin no zhes pa 'di kho nar pa ti'i dgag pa bya ste /
analyzed: sa khi t'a sogs la aagni bzhin ma yin no zhes pa 'di kho nar pa ti'i dgag pa bya ste /
translated: The negative particle is to be applied only to patī in the expression sakhitā etc. are not like agni,

original: de la ji ltar sa khi'i sgra 'ba' zhig pa de t'a la sogs pa la aagni'i ming can dgag par bya'i de'i mtha' can ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de la ji ltar sa khi'i sgra 'ba' zhig pa de t'a la sogs pa la aagni'i ming can dgag par bya'i de'i mtha' can ni ma yin la /
translated: just as the negative particle is applied only to the word sakhi in the expression sakhi etc. are not like agni, and not to the suffix etc. that follow it.

original: aa ti sa khye r'a gatstsha ti zhes pa de ltar pa ti'i sgra 'ba' zhig pa'i dgag pa bshad par bya'i de'i mtha' can gyi ni 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: aa ti sa khye r'a gatstsha ti zhes pa de ltar pa ti'i sgra 'ba' zhig pa'i dgag pa bshad par bya'i de'i mtha' can gyi ni 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just as in the expression atisa-khyē rāg-cchatsati, the negative particle is explained only for the word patī, and not for the suffix etc. that follow it.

original: de ltar grub pas gang pa ti bsdu ba ma yin pa la'o zhes pa 'dis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar grub pas gang pa ti bsdu ba ma yin pa la'o zhes pa 'dis bsgrub par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Since this is established, it is not to be established by this expression not in the inclusive patī.

original: 'dis bya ba'i bsgrub pa ni de mi rtag pa nyid du shes par byed pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'dis bya ba'i bsgrub pa ni de mi rtag pa nyid du shes par byed pa'i don du'o //
translated: The function of this is for the purpose of making known that impermanence.

original: des na pa too dzi ba ti kunda sy'a ta ga te mri te pra bra dzi te ka le be tsa ya ti te pa too zhes pa la sogs pa mchog gi sbyor ba rnams 'thad do zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: des na pa too dzi ba ti kunda sy'a ta ga te mri te pra bra dzi te ka le be tsa ya ti te pa too zhes pa la sogs pa mchog gi sbyor ba rnams 'thad do zhes kha cig go //
translated: Therefore, the supreme applications such as “patoyajivati kundasyāgataḥ mṛtaḥ pravraji-taḥ kaleva cayati te patoy” are tenable, some say.

original: sa khi t'a sogs la aagni ma yin no zhes pa'i mdo 'dir 'grel bshad byed pas ni 'di skad gsungs te /
analyzed: sa khi t'a sogs la aagni ma yin no zhes pa'i mdo 'dir 'grel bshad byed pas ni 'di skad gsungs te /
translated: The commentary on this sūtra, “sakṛt is not agni,” says this:

original: de'i mtha' yang dgag pa kho na'o zhes des so //
analyzed: de'i mtha' yang dgag pa kho na'o zhes des so //
translated: “The end of that is only negation,” by that.

original: baha ba:sa kh'a yo aasya /🔽ba hu sa kh'a /
analyzed: baha ba:sa kh'a yo aasya / ba hu sa kh'a /

original: ba hu sa khye'o //
analyzed: ba hu sa khye'o //

original: ji ltar aa ti sa khe:yin zhes bshad par rtsod do zhes sa kh'in stri yam ma ti gr'anta sya /
analyzed: ji ltar aa ti sa khe:yin zhes bshad par rtsod do zhes sa kh'in stri yam ma ti gr'anta sya /
translated: “How is it said that sakṛt is atisakṛt?” is disputed. Sakṛt striyam matigrantasya.

original: aa te sa khe:zhes pa nye bar bsgrub pa nyid kyi phyir thung du ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: aa te sa khe:zhes pa nye bar bsgrub pa nyid kyi phyir thung du ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: “Sakṛt” is not short because of the very application of the affix.

original: pha rol gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi bsgyur ba ni snga ma la de kho na'o zhes str'i yig kho na 'di yin te /
analyzed: pha rol gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi bsgyur ba ni snga ma la de kho na'o zhes str'i yig kho na 'di yin te /
translated: The other, the rational transformation, is the same as the former.

original: sa khi'i gnas su ni ma yin no zhes pas dgag pa ga la 'gyur zhe na /🔽rnam dbye rnams la rtags smos pa na rtags khyad par yang smos pa'o zhes pas gus par @6a * //
analyzed: sa khi'i gnas su ni ma yin no zhes pas dgag pa ga la 'gyur zhe na / rnam dbye rnams la rtags smos pa na rtags khyad par yang smos pa'o zhes pas gus par @6a * //
translated: How can the particle eva be a negation, as in “not in the locative case”?

original: bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Since it is said that when a case ending is mentioned, the special case ending is also mentioned, it is not respectful.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sa khi pa ti dag t'a la sogs pa la aagni ma yin no zhes pa bsgrub par mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sa khi pa ti dag t'a la sogs pa la aagni ma yin no zhes pa bsgrub par mi bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in the case of sakhi, pati, and so on, it should not be established that agni is not.

original: pa tyo / pa ti shu /
analyzed: pa tyo / pa ti shu /

original: kun du bod pa la /
analyzed: kun du bod pa la /

original: he pa te /
analyzed: he pa te /

original: te pa t'i /
analyzed: te pa t'i /

original: he pa ta ya /
analyzed: he pa ta ya /

original: // / a'i yig gi mtha' can w'a ta mri ga brjod par bya ba w'a ta pra m'i'i sgra ste /
analyzed: // / a'i yig gi mtha' can w'a ta mri ga brjod par bya ba w'a ta pra m'i'i sgra ste /
translated: The word vātaprami is to be expressed with the ending of the letter ai, namely vātaprami.

original: 'di yang rkang bzhi pa'i rigs can nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di yang rkang bzhi pa'i rigs can nyid kyi phyir /
translated: This also belongs to the class of four-footed words,

original: bud med dang skyes pa dag la 'jug go //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa dag la 'jug go //
translated: so it applies to women and men.

original: de ltar ni ait dang aut kyi mtha' can b'a tsi dang tsa mu la sogs pa zhes pa rtags kyis tshig le'ur byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bud med nyid du thob pa la gnyis dang bzhi'i rkang pa can bhra ma ra dang ba ra ta zhes bya ba
analyzed: de ltar ni ait dang aut kyi mtha' can b'a tsi dang tsa mu la sogs pa zhes pa rtags kyis tshig le'ur byas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bud med nyid du thob pa la gnyis dang bzhi'i rkang pa can bhra ma ra dang ba ra ta zhes bya ba
translated: This is the feminine gender, because it has two or four feet, such as bhramarā and varatā.

original: 'dis phyi ma nyid kyi phyir 'di bud med dang skyes pa'i rtags can nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis phyi ma nyid kyi phyir 'di bud med dang skyes pa'i rtags can nyid do //
translated: Because of this, it has the characteristics of a woman or a man.

original: de la skyes pa la ni w'a ta pra m'i:/
analyzed: de la skyes pa la ni w'a ta pra m'i:/
translated: Among them, for a man, it is vātāpramiḥ.

original: dbyangs dang po can gyi si sogs thams cad la ai'i yi ge ya zhes pa la sogs pas ya nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: dbyangs dang po can gyi si sogs thams cad la ai'i yi ge ya zhes pa la sogs pas ya nyid kho na'o //
translated: All the sibilants beginning with the first vowel, such as si, etc., have the letter i, such as ya, etc., and are only ya.

original: w'a ta pra myoo /
analyzed: w'a ta pra myoo /

original: w'a ta pra mya:zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: w'a ta pra mya:zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

original: 'dir pha rol po rnams ni aam pha rol snga ma'o zhes pas aam gyi aa yig pha rol snga ma nyid la /🔽w'a ta pra m'im /
analyzed: 'dir pha rol po rnams ni aam pha rol snga ma'o zhes pas aam gyi aa yig pha rol snga ma nyid la / w'a ta pra m'im /
translated: Here, the opponents say that the a of aṃ is the preceding one, so the a of aṃ is the preceding one itself.🔽Vātāpramiṃ.

original: w'a ta pa myoo /
analyzed: w'a ta pa myoo /

original: shas la'ang dang po dag gi aatsala'o zhes pas aa yig dang a'i yig dag ring po nyid kyis na ai yig dang / de las shas kyi na skyes pa la'o zhes pas sa'i 'ang na nyid yin pa na w'a ta pra m'in /
analyzed: shas la'ang dang po dag gi aatsala'o zhes pas aa yig dang a'i yig dag ring po nyid kyis na ai yig dang / de las shas kyi na skyes pa la'o zhes pas sa'i 'ang na nyid yin pa na w'a ta pra m'in /
translated: Thus, the sa also has a long na.

original: kho bo cag gi ni yi ge'i a'a ga ma ni /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi ni yi ge'i a'a ga ma ni /
translated: Our a is the next letter.🔽The reversed letter is the child of the a of the aṃ and aḥ.🔽The sa has the long na.

original: yi ge bzlog pa yang zhes pa la sogs pas aamshas dag gi aa yig byis pa na dang / sa'i 'ad na nyid la gzugs gnyis pa 'di 'grub par bya'o zhes mchan par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge bzlog pa yang zhes pa la sogs pas aamshas dag gi aa yig byis pa na dang / sa'i 'ad na nyid la gzugs gnyis pa 'di 'grub par bya'o zhes mchan par bya'o //
translated: This second form should be made.

original: bdun pa'i gcig gi tshig la mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la zhes pa la sogs pas ring po dang pha rol dbyi ba dag go //
analyzed: bdun pa'i gcig gi tshig la mtshungs pa 'dra ba'i yi ge la zhes pa la sogs pas ring po dang pha rol dbyi ba dag go //
translated: In the word of the singular of the seventh, the similar letter is the long and the reversed.

original: w'a ta pra m'i /
analyzed: w'a ta pra m'i /

original: gang yang byings ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ma bsgrubs pa yin yang yi ge gcig ma yin pa dag gi zhes pa la sogs pas ya nyid la kha cig gus par byed mod de bsam pa cis yin zhes kho bos mi shes so //
analyzed: gang yang byings ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ma bsgrubs pa yin yang yi ge gcig ma yin pa dag gi zhes pa la sogs pas ya nyid la kha cig gus par byed mod de bsam pa cis yin zhes kho bos mi shes so //
translated: But since it is not a root, it is not formed. However, some out of respect for the single letter a and so on, say ya. I do not know what they are thinking.

original: kun du bod pa la /🔽he w'a ta pra mi /
analyzed: kun du bod pa la / he w'a ta pra mi /
translated: The general rule is:🔽he va ta pra mi🔽he va ta pra myo

original: he w'a ta pra myo /
analyzed: he w'a ta pra myo /

original: hee w'a ta pra mya:bud med la ni bud med kyi skabs nyid du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: hee w'a ta pra mya:bud med la ni bud med kyi skabs nyid du bshad par bya'o //
translated: For a woman, it should be explained in the section on women.

original: de bzhin du a'i yig gi mtha' can gzhan rnams kyang rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du a'i yig gi mtha' can gzhan rnams kyang rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the others ending in the letter a should be understood by implication.

original: au yig gi mtha' can aam shu'i sgra ni rtags kyi ming la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: au yig gi mtha' can aam shu'i sgra ni rtags kyi ming la sogs pa snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The sound aṃśu ending in the letter u is a mark and so on, as before.

original: skyes pa la mtshan nyid @6b aagni dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: skyes pa la mtshan nyid @6b aagni dang 'dra'o //
translated: For a man, it is like the characteristic aṅga.

original: snga ma'i dbyangs au'o //
analyzed: snga ma'i dbyangs au'o //

analyzed: au'i yi ge la ao'o zhes pa ao nyid de pha rol dbyi'o zhes pa khyad par ro //

analyzed: phyogs gcig la ni si la'ang ma gha wan ni ma gha wantu yang na'o zhes pa ma gha wana'i sgra'i ma gha wantu'o //
translated: In one place, si is also maghonah, and maghonah is also maghonatu.

analyzed: au yig ni aantu dang aas mtha'i 'ang byings ma yin pa'i si la'o zhes pa'i khyad par gyi don to //

original: 'di nyid kho nas ring po'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid kho nas ring po'o //

analyzed: brtsegs pa'i mtha'i dbyi'o zhes pas mtha' dbyi'o //

analyzed: na dang brtsegs pa'i mtha' dag ni cho ga snga ma la ma phyis pa bzhin 'ang ngo zhes pas na dbyi ba med do // ma gha w'an /

analyzed: @11a * // ma gha wa ta:/ ma gha wa t'a /

translated: The anusvāra of the vowels and consonants is elided by the rule not ghuṭ.🔽The anusvāra of the vowels and consonants is elided by the rule not ghuṭ.🔽The anusvāra of the vowels and consonants is elided by the rule not ghuṭ.

original: gal te nanya med na'o //🔽de nas ma gha wan dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gal te nanya med na'o // de nas ma gha wan dang 'dra'o //
translated: The anusvāra of the vowels and consonants is elided by the rule not ghuṭ.🔽The anusvāra of the vowels and consonants is elided by the rule not ghuṭ.🔽The anusvāra of the vowels and consonants is elided by the rule not ghuṭ.🔽The anusvāra of the vowels and consonants is elided by the rule not ghuṭ.

analyzed: aarwantoo / aarwanta:/ zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The anusvāra of the vowels and consonants is elided by the rule not ghuṭ.

original: bud med la aarwant'i'o //
analyzed: bud med la aarwant'i'o //

original: bshad pa mdzad pas ni bshad pa la ma gha wantu dang aarwana'i sgra dag gi magha wantu dang aarwanti dag mi 'dod de sdeb sbyor can nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa mdzad pas ni bshad pa la ma gha wantu dang aarwana'i sgra dag gi magha wantu dang aarwanti dag mi 'dod de sdeb sbyor can nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: de ltar ni bshad pa aarwan /
analyzed: de ltar ni bshad pa aarwan /

original: na strin dang / ma gho na'i 'ang bslab par bya ba min te /
analyzed: na strin dang / ma gho na'i 'ang bslab par bya ba min te /

original: de ni sdeb sbyor can yin pas so //
analyzed: de ni sdeb sbyor can yin pas so //

original: ma tu sa dang sha tri dag gis sgrub pa bzhin du sdeb sbyor la ste /
analyzed: ma tu sa dang sha tri dag gis sgrub pa bzhin du sdeb sbyor la ste /
translated: Like the formations of matu and satri, they are in meter.

original: gnyi ga bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga bstan pa'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //

original: 'o na shla thi krita pra gra ha marba t'am bradz'a:/
analyzed: 'o na shla thi krita pra gra ha marba t'am bradz'a:/

original: ma gha bad badzra madzdza ni da nam /
analyzed: ma gha bad badzra madzdza ni da nam /

original: zhes pa ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa ci ltar zhe na /

original: sdeb sbyor can rnams kyang snyan dngags mkhan rnams ming gi sgra nyid kyi phyir skad la sbyor te /
analyzed: sdeb sbyor can rnams kyang snyan dngags mkhan rnams ming gi sgra nyid kyi phyir skad la sbyor te /
translated: Even the metrical ones are applied to the language by poets because of the sound of the name itself.

original: dper na / tu ra ya tri la sogs pa rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / tu ra ya tri la sogs pa rnams bzhin no //
translated: For example, like turya tri and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis bshad par ma gha wantu dang / aarwanti dag sgrub pa'i mdo gnyis mdzad do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis bshad par ma gha wantu dang / aarwanti dag sgrub pa'i mdo gnyis mdzad do //
translated: For this very reason, the Master composed two sutras for the establishment of Maghavat and Arvinda.

original: panthi'i sgra las si la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: panthi'i sgra las si la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The word panth means the sibilants, etc.

original: panthi dang manthi dang ri bhukshi rnams kyi si la'o zhes pas ai yig gi a'a yig go //
analyzed: panthi dang manthi dang ri bhukshi rnams kyi si la'o zhes pas ai yig gi a'a yig go //
translated: Since it is said, The sibilants of panthi, manthi, and ribhukṣi, the i of i is changed to ā.

original: si'i rnam par gcad bya'o //
analyzed: si'i rnam par gcad bya'o //

original: panth'a:/ ghuta la aan mtha'o zhes pas ghuta pha rol la mtha' aan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: panth'a:/ ghuta la aan mtha'o zhes pas ghuta pha rol la mtha' aan du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is said, Ghuṭa has an at the end, the sibilant becomes an at the end of ghuṭa.

original: ghu ta la'ang sam buddhi ma yin pa la'o zhes pas au pa dh'a ring po nyid do //
analyzed: ghu ta la'ang sam buddhi ma yin pa la'o zhes pas au pa dh'a ring po nyid do //
translated: Since it is said, Also, in the absence of ghuṭa, the u is lengthened.🔽Panthānoḥ

original: panth'a noo / pantha na:/
analyzed: panth'a noo / pantha na:/

original: panth'a nam:/ panth'a noo //🔽ghu ta ma yin pa'i dbyangs la dbyi'o zhes pas ghu ta ma yin pa'i dbyangs pha rol la mtha' dbyi'o //
analyzed: panth'a nam:/ panth'a noo // ghu ta ma yin pa'i dbyangs la dbyi'o zhes pas ghu ta ma yin pa'i dbyangs pha rol la mtha' dbyi'o //
translated: Panthānām🔽Since it is said, The sibilants are elided in the absence of ghuṭa, the sibilants are elided at the end of the vowel in the absence of ghuṭa.

original: gsal byed la'ang 'di rnams kyi ni'o zhes pas ghu ta ma yin pa'i dbyangs dang gsal byed dag la na dbyi bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsal byed la'ang 'di rnams kyi ni'o zhes pas ghu ta ma yin pa'i dbyangs dang gsal byed dag la na dbyi bar bya'o //
translated: Since it is said, Also, these are for the consonants, the sibilants and consonants in the absence of ghuṭa are elided.

analyzed: pa tha:/ pa th'a / pa thi bhy'am /

analyzed: pa thi bhi:/ pa the / pa thi bhy'am /

analyzed: pa thi bhya:/ pa tha:/ pa thi bhy'am /

analyzed: pa thi bhya:/ pa tha:/ pa tho:/ pa th'am /

analyzed: pa thi / pa tho:/

analyzed: pa thi shu /

analyzed: kun du bod pa la /

original: sam buddhi l'ang ngo zhes pa 'di las @11b pha rol nyid kyi phyir a'a nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: sam buddhi l'ang ngo zhes pa 'di las @11b pha rol nyid kyi phyir a'a nyid kho na'o //
translated: And also in the sense of 'Buddha' (buddha).

original: he panth'a:/ he panth'a noo /
analyzed: he panth'a:/ he panth'a noo /

original: he panth'a na:/ de bzhin du manthi dang / ri bhu kshi'o //
analyzed: he panth'a na:/ de bzhin du manthi dang / ri bhu kshi'o //
translated: In the same way, manthin and ribhukṣi.

original: 'o na 'di rnams aita mtha' ste /
analyzed: 'o na 'di rnams aita mtha' ste /
translated: But these are all in the locative case.

original: de'i phyir na mtha'i skabs su dper rjod pa ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir na mtha'i skabs su dper rjod pa ji ltar zhe na /
translated: So how can they be used as examples at the end?

original: bden te kha cig 'di rnams na mtha' ru 'dod do //
analyzed: bden te kha cig 'di rnams na mtha' ru 'dod do //
translated: True, but some people do consider them to be at the end.

original: de skad du 'grel bshad ni kha cig panthin manthin ri bhu kshin zhes na mtha' can gyi rang bzhin 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: de skad du 'grel bshad ni kha cig panthin manthin ri bhu kshin zhes na mtha' can gyi rang bzhin 'dzin par byed do //
translated: Thus the commentary says: 'Some people take panthin, manthin and ribhukṣi as having the locative ending.'

original: aa nanta ghu ta'o zhes 'dir mtha' ma yin pa ni aa nanta'o zhes ma yin par dgag pa las mtha' dang nye ba'i aa yig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa nanta ghu ta'o zhes 'dir mtha' ma yin pa ni aa nanta'o zhes ma yin par dgag pa las mtha' dang nye ba'i aa yig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The word anantā is not anantā but anantā, where the final a is elided by the rule of a-anantā, and the final a is changed to the nasal sound.

original: ghu ta ma yin pa'i dbyangs la dbyi'o zhes pa 'dir yang mtha' ma yin pa kho na'i yi ga dbyi bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: ghu ta ma yin pa'i dbyangs la dbyi'o zhes pa 'dir yang mtha' ma yin pa kho na'i yi ga dbyi bar 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: In the word ghutā, the final a is elided by the rule of ghutā-anādeśa, and the final a is changed to the nasal sound.🔽By the force of mentioning these, the final a of the consonants is also elided by the rule of a-anantā, and the final a is changed to the nasal sound.

original: 'di rnams smos pa'i shugs las gsal byed la'ang 'di rnams kyi mtha' ma yin pa rnams kyi yang na yig dbyi bar 'gyur ro zhes so //🔽na mtha'i 'ang ma ning gi kun du bod pa la yang lam'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams smos pa'i shugs las gsal byed la'ang 'di rnams kyi mtha' ma yin pa rnams kyi yang na yig dbyi bar 'gyur ro zhes so // na mtha'i 'ang ma ning gi kun du bod pa la yang lam'o //
translated: The final a of na is also elided by the rule of a-anantā, and the final a is changed to the nasal sound in the neuter affix.

original: de skad du'ang t'i k'ar ni na mtha'i phyogs la ni ma ning gi kun du bod pa la na yig gnas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de skad du'ang t'i k'ar ni na mtha'i phyogs la ni ma ning gi kun du bod pa la na yig gnas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is said in the Tika: In the case of the final 'na', the neuter affix also has the nasal sound.

original: su dang aa ti dag gi sbyor ba la aa ta'i mtha' can med de /🔽he su pa thin ku la zhes so //
analyzed: su dang aa ti dag gi sbyor ba la aa ta'i mtha' can med de / he su pa thin ku la zhes so //
translated: In the combination of su and ati, the final a of ati is not elided.

original: he su pa thi ku la zhes rtag tu de la brjod par 'gyur ba ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: he su pa thi ku la zhes rtag tu de la brjod par 'gyur ba ma yin pa kho na'o zhes pa'o //
translated: It is not at all to be said that it is always pushapatikula.

original: des na na mtha'i skabs su dper brjod par bya'i ai ta'i mtha' can ma yin te /
analyzed: des na na mtha'i skabs su dper brjod par bya'i ai ta'i mtha' can ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, at the end of na, it is to be exemplified, but not with the ending of ita.

original: gzugs tha dad pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs tha dad pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes pa'o //
translated: There is no fault because of the difference in form.

original: pu sha na'i sgra las si la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: pu sha na'i sgra las si la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: From the word pusha, there are si and so on.

original: ain dang han dang pu shan dang aar++ya man rnams kyi shi la'ang ngo zhes pa'i nges pa las /
analyzed: ain dang han dang pu shan dang aar++ya man rnams kyi shi la'ang ngo zhes pa'i nges pa las /
translated: And also shi of ein, han, pushan, and aryama, by the rule.

original: sam buddhi ma yin pa'i si la ring po nyid do //
analyzed: sam buddhi ma yin pa'i si la ring po nyid do //
translated: The si is lengthened, except in sambuddhi.🔽pusha

translated: Dhenu, all around.🔽Hedeno.🔽Hedenu.🔽Hedenava.🔽In the same way,🔽ikshu, akhu,🔽iru, aru,🔽rudra, karana,🔽satidru,🔽sindhu, satadru,🔽kantuka, kakuka,🔽priyangu,🔽kuharahula,🔽rajjhu, hanu, in the same way,🔽kunaru,🔽mrityu, alu, and so on.

analyzed: dzambu ra la ts'u tumbi ka'i 'bras bu'o //

original: shakti zhes bya ba'i mtshan cha la k'a s'u'o //
analyzed: shakti zhes bya ba'i mtshan cha la k'a s'u'o //
translated: Śakti is for “to have a weapon.”

original: k'andh'u pha rol gyi nor 'phrog pa la'o //
analyzed: k'andh'u pha rol gyi nor 'phrog pa la'o //

original: p'a du bu dhinta /🔽banna dhvi / ba r'u skyo ba la tsa m'u'ang ngo //
analyzed: p'a du bu dhinta / banna dhvi / ba r'u skyo ba la tsa m'u'ang ngo //

original: dvi r'a d'a di /
analyzed: dvi r'a d'a di /
translated: Varu is for “to be sad.”🔽Dvirādhi is for “to be two.”

original: dhi sh'u chung mar yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dhi sh'u chung mar yang shes par bya'o //
translated: Dhīśu is also to be known as “wife.”

original: kan'i ya s'i ku k'u de ni gnam stong zad pa gang du zla ba'i cha ru 'gyur ro //🔽ya ti ya no /
analyzed: kan'i ya s'i ku k'u de ni gnam stong zad pa gang du zla ba'i cha ru 'gyur ro // ya ti ya no /
translated: Kaṇīyasī is the last day of the month, when the moon is not visible.

original: ni pra p'u'o //
analyzed: ni pra p'u'o //
translated: Yati is for “to be a sage.”🔽Ni is for “to be a child.”

analyzed: bhr'u'i sgra ni shr'i'i sgra dang 'dra bar drang bar bya ste /

analyzed: bhr'u byings bzhin no zhes bsgre ba las so //

analyzed: a'am la'ang nu'o // pu narbh'u n'am /
translated: Also, a and au.🔽Punar bhuvam, again the world.

original: he pu narbhva:/ de bzhin du /
analyzed: he pu narbhva:/ de bzhin du /

original: dbyar rnams su 'byung ngo zhes pas kvi pa'o //
analyzed: dbyar rnams su 'byung ngo zhes pas kvi pa'o //
